content.introCopy:
I’m Hannah and I’m a front end developer living in New York.

I’ve been a developer for 3 years. And. I. Love. It.

I've always been a creative person, no matter what the medium. I have a BFA from Pratt Institute for Fashion Design, which led me down a path where I was at one point pursuing a Masters degree in Costume History from the Fashion Institute of Technology (incomplete). I also am graduate of the Marinello School of Beauty School in California. This is all well before my fellowship at the Flatiron School though.
content.otherCopy:
My favorite language is JavaScript.

I'm a big fan of BEM in my SCSS, I find flattening my nested classes to be quite satisfying.

I like to go to go to meetups, and I keep my blog up from when I went to school.
content.workCopy:
But enough about me, let me tell you about my work.

My most recent position was at Fast Company. There I worked as a front end developer for the last 1.5 years, and was part of a team that went through two design refreshes as well as a stack update. I also created multiple client side components for our family of sites including: Innovation By Design awards, Most Innovative Companies awards, and our breaking news and opinion site, FastCo. News.

Prior to that, I was a developer at ESPN on their ad production team. I helped bring ad campaigns to fruition, troubleshot malfunctioning code and also created internal tools for our account managers’ lives easier.

I also have worked for two Rails based dev shops, The Maki Fund and Wizard Development.
content.meetupCopy: It would be a pleasure to get to know you as well.  Want to get coffee?
